intro: Coreopsis leucantha, commonly known as white coreopsis, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of 1 to 3 feet, featuring slender, branching stems. The plant produces showy, daisy-like flowers with white petals and a yellow center, blooming from late spring to early fall. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, giving them a slightly fuzzy texture. White coreopsis thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for garden landscapes.
